question: Vata-bhuta refers to which of the following?
option2: Kingâ€™s customary share of the produce normally amounting to one-sixth of the produce, paid by all cultivators.
option3: Cesses for the maintenance of rites performed for the winds and spirits.
answer: Cesses for the maintenance of rites performed for the winds and spirits.
explanation: During the Gupta period vata-bhuta tax was also collected. It probably refers to cesses for the maintenance of rites performed for the winds and spirits.
